content: @Sebastian Ullrich Do you think you could replace the link to the mathlib GitHub from https://leanprover.github.io/about/ by a link to https://leanprover-community.github.io/. And maybe also add a visible link from the documentation page. If you want something which is specifically about documentation then you can target https://leanprover-community.github.io/learn.html. The download page could contain a link to https://leanprover-community.github.io/get_started.html. And of course getting of the link to https://leanprover.github.io/live/ would be awesome

Let me know if anything else should be clarified. There's still a bit of overlap with the community homepage, of course, but I suppose we'd want the official website to be at least somewhat standalone.

@Sebastian Ullrich Thanks!
But do you still want to mention the google groups forum on https://leanprover.github.io/documentation/ ? Is there anybody there?
The answer to every question asked there seems to be "ask the same question on Zulip", but conversely there will be people who won't want to face this bear pit
Yeah, all these conference invitations need a home as well
